message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CR 

The paper deals with learning algorithms and coding theory, which are both relevant to machine learning and information theory. The use of statistical queries and the focus on noise tolerance suggest that the paper may fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The mention of decoding linear codes suggests that the paper may also be relevant to information theory (cs.IT). The use of algorithms and the focus on complexity suggest that the paper may also fall under the category of data structures (cs.DS) or computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the mention of random classification noise suggests that the paper may also be relevant to cryptography (cs.CR).
